pros: Helpful team members and mangers. 100% discount for lunch. Requiring hand washing often! Fresh hot fries, Keep up the good work! Our ice cream machine works, thank you Mr. Joe! Managers treat employees with respect; no micromanaging. Quick hire. Franchise finally evaluating pay ans increasing it from 7.50 to 8.50 to around $10/$12.
cons: Takes too long to increase pay to at least half of georgias living wage... can Mcdonalds really not afford it... dont know/ask an auditor.... what i do know is .....Underpaying hardworking people and not being upfront about payment methods stops people from wanting to work at McDonald's. Anything under $15.00 in the city of midway is not"reasonable". Even if you do hire children/people "who takes whats given to them without considering could this wage help or hurt me". All im saying is to Never take advantage of your workers. It's not just *your customers that keep you in business* ITS THE EMPLOYEES! Pay them well or you will always get a high turnover rate. If you dont care about them working for you for long periods of time pay them low... managers stay cause they get paid well employees leave because they internally know theres an imbalance between work and pay. Which has proven itself each year. The pay doesnt sit right in people's spirit!

pros: Good learning experience for a first job. Certainly teaches a lot of important skills: multitasking, thinking fast, respect to customers. I am glad I worked here at the beginning of my career but I feel so much for any person working there now because I know how hard it is.
cons: Refuse to let employees sit down for the entire shift unless they are on their lunch break. Is this an attempt to keep people so exhausted that have no energy to apply for other jobs at the end of the day?? This is unethical.

pros: Nothing much, I did make a small handful of friends the rest I can say otherwise. Free food
cons: It was initially good but eventually went downhill due to high turnover of management and other staff, the good ones all left because they had seen what I’m now seeing within these premises .unfortunately I haven’t got many positive things to say about the particular stores I have worked at as both crew and shift manager…… I would not recommend to anyone, I deeply regret ever working or meeting the majority of people there. I may have ruffled feathers by standing up for my rights but there is no excuse for restaurant managers to bully and intimidate me !!! They will also drain the living life out of you with unrealistic expectations workload given and the competition between different stores and managers. You’ll end up leave feeling unworthy even after upper management point out your mistakes in the group chat for everyone (including other stores) to see afterwards, your name tagged, everything which I find crosses the line.., What happened to focussing on customer satisfaction rather than focusing on rankings and seeing who’s a better manager than who, this? I can see why customers get angry! It’s pretty funny that I have been working in three different stores owned by the same licencee who only care about the $$$$ and treat others below him so bad if his status and money isn’t up to scratch! Also I don’t support their false advertisements like RUOK or anything like what they post on social media as this company dosent stay true to their word!! The pay I can say isn’t worth on how much the workload is given to you and the reason why McDonald’s is understaffed is because people are leaving, and I would love to say I’m one of them, no regrets. Um also in saying that, please sort out your “privileged” restaurant managers with their poor attitudes toward others and who care about impressing the licensee. They will bully and bully others until they get their own way even if it means throwing tantrums! They are the particular reason as to why other staff are running the other way!!! just FYI I am aiming this at those particular stores in the western suburbs.

review_title: Become a soulless husk for just 12$ an hour!
pros: -Employees were given access to food and drink from the store for free -Co-Workers were most often pleasant -Hours were somewhat flexible
cons: -I asked for 4 months straight for them to move my payment method from the company's paycard to my own account, and in the 4 months of me asking not once did they EVER do it. I'm convinced they never will rectify this. I have asked insistently, I have stated how long I have been waiting, our General Manager does not seem to care. -We're horribly understaffed, and are incredibly busy. Management does not seem to bring in enough new people, and people continue to quit due to its horrible conditions. -Employees typically have to do the jobs of 2-3 people at once. It's not unusual to have nights where there are less than 7 of us in the entire store no matter how busy it is. -Despite employee work, we're still being payed less than almost everywhere else for doing more. -Are very loose with workers' shifts, hours, and times. Often moving them around on a whim without notice. I've heard of someone marking a day off, having it being counted as a day off, then having the company unmark it and force the person in.

pros: My role at McDonald’s means I have to intersect with customers on a Dailey basis. This has provided me with valuable experience in dealing with customer queries and complaints. I pride myself on the my knowledge and ability to provide a solution that is satisfactory for both the company and customer. As well as customers facing experience I have gained vital skills and insights to working within a team skills such as these are fundamental for the effectiveness of a team. By working within an effective team I’ve gained the experience to understand and lead teams so that we can achieve a common goal, these goals can come in several forms such as amount of customers served, quality of service or retention of customers. As McDonald’s relies on customer experiences to bring in customers it’s vital that me and my team can provide these transferable skills throughout a shift.
cons: As well as working at McDonald’s I work part time in a family owed restaurant chain. This again gives me crucial insight into customer service and the operations of a business. This has provided me with the foundations of my interests of customer service.

Will recommend

There is favoritism, i've seen racisim, and has upper management that doesn't listen to it's general managers or department managers. If you are a hard worker you will be exploited and lazy people get away with anything and the hard workers are over worked.
